channel.title: I re-did shops, got this error
channel.description:
I dont get any errors in compiler, but when i run server this comes up: exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException:2 at ShopHandler.loadShops(ShopHandler.java:124 at ShopHandler.<init>(ShopHandler.java:31) at server.main(server.java:29)
After that nobody can log on they just keep dcing.... Help if you can please!

item.title: I re-did shops, got this error
item.dc:creator: @wintzer wintzer
item.description:
@wintzer wrote:

FIXED IT
It was so simple and im so stupid… i deleted all the unused shops in shops.cfg and its done!
New question though… what are the directions for npcs and where to set

Read full topic

item.source: I re-did shops, got this error

item.title: I re-did shops, got this error
item.dc:creator: @Project_Realm Project Realm
item.description:
@Project_Realm wrote:

It’s quite a simple exception. Somewhere in your “loadShops” method there is an array that is referenced. This specific exception means you are trying to read a part of this array that doesn’t exist. For example, if I had an array of 5 integers (let’s say, 0, 1, 2, 3 and 4) and I tried reading the sixth integer from that array, I would get this exception because there is no sixth integer (it doesn’t exist). Try reading through the method and find where an array is used. That’s most likely where the error is occurring.

Also, I find it much easier using an IDE, like Eclipse, while coding, as solving this problem with the built-in debugger would be a lot easier.

Read full topic

item.title: I re-did shops, got this error

item.description:
@wintzer wrote:

Ok well i had a backup file and i moved over all the work i did on the Autospawn onto the backup, no errors so it has to be in the actual shops. I tried moving 1 shop over at a time and now i ran into another problem i think
i get on and the shop didnt get replaced by the new shop… i cant believe i forgot this… how do i link the npc to the shop?

item.title: I re-did shops, got this error
item.dc:creator: @pl0x15 pl0x15
item.description:
@pl0x15 wrote:

Either Server.java is misplaced, you made a fatal error in coding, or you need to reset your variables.

The fatal error thing slips passed the compiler, its technically right, but theres a tiny problem that screws up your run.bat. Such as when adding items, like zoomers dclaws tut, it says its right in compiler but it fks ur run.bat So everything you did with shops, un-do certain things and see if it works

Read full topic
